instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message:
Hi, this computer arrived turning on but without video, it has all the power rails, it turns on and get to .290 A shuts down one time and goes again to .340 A. Has SUS voltages, no visible corrosion, all rails present what else to check? 
SMC bypass only turns on when I remove my tweezers from <RESISTOR>R5116</RESISTOR> (when holding for 10-15 seconds, it does nothing. Is this normal behavior?)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message:
Any history fault available?

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?
Did you try known good BIOS?

MacBook cannot turn on if <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is maintained tied to ground.
The mentioned behavior is normal.
SMC bypass mode can be recognized because the fan must start with full speed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message:
Tried known good BIOS, nothing
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> not present, removed <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and found that PIN 8 was gone, so replaced <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and put a jumper from PIN 8 to <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> PIN 1. Then found out that <RESISTOR>R1950</RESISTOR> was missing... put a new resistor on <RESISTOR>R1950</RESISTOR> place and did the trick, it is working now!
Thank you 2informaticos!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message: 2click, you wrote in the beginning " computer arrived turning on but without video ". Did it make chime sound?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message: No sound, it was doing nothing...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message:
2click, I have the same motherboard with similar problem with  <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> not present and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> only 0.54V.
Can you please confirm me that there is actual <RESISTOR>R8162</RESISTOR>. It should be very next to <RESISTOR>R1950</RESISTOR>.
On my board, this resistor is missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message:
Machine cannot chime, if <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is missing.
PCH didn't received correct signal from pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> in his case.

<CHIP>U8160</CHIP> and associated resistors are not place on the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message: Did you make your board work? If you don´t have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> you should definitely check that first... maybe you have a short on that line.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> .290 A Fan Spin but no activity
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2click, post: 71410, member: 24760"]
Did you make your board work? If you don´t have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> you should definitely check that first... maybe you have a short on that line.
[/QUOTE]
If this was a question for me, yes I made it work. I have soldered new <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> which is TPS22924C load switch on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>. After that everything started to work fine. I have tested the laptop for about 2 hours when suddenly fan started running at full speed. It sems I had a bad luck and palm rest sensor faild. But Macs fan control applicatio in automatic mode on CPU senosor solved the fan noise. Laptop is worling without any delays and very responsive. The customer was happy to have his laptop fully functional again. So I consider this job done.
